GroupCONSORT 0.1.0

Prepare survival::cgd for a consortr demonstration

Source: R/example.R
prep_cgd_example.Rd

Reduces the CGD recurrent-events dataset to one row per patient and adds a region column grouping the 14 trial centres into North America and Europe. survival ships with every R installation so no extra packages are needed.

Usage

prep_cgd_example()

Value

A tibble with 128 rows and columns id, center, region, age, weight, sex, inherit, steroids, treat, status, follow_up_days.

Examples

cgd <- prep_cgd_example()
cohort <- new_cohort(cgd, label = "Randomised", id_col = "id",
                     group_col = "region") |>
  include_if(age >= 5, "Age >= 5 years") |>
  include_if(weight >= 15, "Weight >= 15 kg") |>
  include_if(steroids == 0, "Not on corticosteroids") |>
  include_if(follow_up_days > 0, "Positive follow-up time")
consort_plot(cohort)
